title: Basic features
text: robonomistClient package follows tidy data principles ensure returned datasets easy work ready analysis. approach helps minimize data preparation time, enabling analysts focus insights rather wrangling data. key principles used: Long Format: Data returned long format whenever possible. means row represents single observation, making ideal use popular analysis visualization tools R, ggplot2 rest tidyverse. Value Variable: long format, measured quantity captured value variable always numeric. ensures consistency across datasets facilitates easy aggregation, summarization, visualization. First Day Period: date-based data (e.g., monthly, quarterly), date represents first day period. example, “March 2024” represented "2024-03-01", making easy sort filter chronologically. Variable Arrangement: Categorical variables, represent grouping dimensions data (region, industry, demographic group), positioned left side dataset. Additional attributes related observations may positioned right side value variable. arrangement ensures categorical identifiers easily distinguishable measurement variables attributes, improving readability simplifying analysis. Consistency: tidy structure allows data seamlessly integrate typical R workflows tools data science, dplyr tidyr. using consistent formatting, robonomistClient data can easily reshaped, filtered, summarized suit wide range analytical needs.

code: data("entsoe/dap_FI") #> # Robonomist id: entsoe/dap_FI #> # Title:         Day ahead price for bidding zone, Finland #> # Vintage:       2025-11-13 16:00:00 #> # A tibble:      653 × 6 #>    Area  Currency `Measure unit` resolution time                value #>  * <chr> <chr>    <chr>          <chr>      <dttm>              <dbl> #>  1 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-07 23:00:00  30.1 #>  2 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-07 23:15:00  27.5 #>  3 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-07 23:30:00  25.9 #>  4 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-07 23:45:00  25.5 #>  5 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 00:00:00  29.5 #>  6 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 00:15:00  27.8 #>  7 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 00:30:00  26.3 #>  8 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 00:45:00  26.2 #>  9 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 01:00:00  30   #> 10 FI    EURO     megawatt hours PT15M      2025-11-08 01:15:00  29.3 #> # ℹ 643 more rows  data("entsoe/dap_FI") |>   ggplot(aes(time, value)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "Electricity prices in Finland",     subtitle = "Day-ahead market price, €/MWh",     caption = "Source: ENTSO-E Transparency Platform.",     x = NULL, y = NULL   )

title: Special datasources
text: St. Louis Fed Database FRED contain +800k time series. can access simply calling data function id time series. example, get US Real Gross Domestic Product (GDPC1):

title: Special datasources
text: FRED api also allows basic time series transformations units parameter:  Allowed values units: lin = Levels (transformation) chg = Change ch1 = Change Year Ago pch = Percent Change pc1 = Percent Change Year Ago pca = Compounded Annual Rate Change cch = Continuously Compounded Rate Change cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate Change log = Natural Log Similarly time series can temporally aggregated frequency aggregation_method parameters:  Allowed values frequency: d = Daily w = Weekly bw = Biweekly m = Monthly q = Quarterly sa = Semiannual = Annual Allowed values aggregation_method: avg = Average sum = Sum eop = End Period
code: data_get(c("fred/CAPB5610CS", "fred/CAPB5640CS"), units = "pc1") |>   drop_na() |>   ggplot(aes(time, value, color = Title)) +   geom_line() +   theme(legend.position = "bottom", legend.direction = "vertical") #> ⠙ Requesting get #> ✔ Requesting get [225ms] #> data_get(c("fred/CAPB5610CS", "fred/CAPB5640CS"), units = "pc1", frequency = "a", aggregation_method = "sum") |>   drop_na() |>   ggplot(aes(time, value, color = Title)) +   geom_line() +   theme(legend.position = "bottom", legend.direction = "vertical") #> ⠙ Requesting get #> ✔ Requesting get [217ms] #>

what: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package robust R client effortless access statistical data. empowers researchers, analysts, developers easily discover, retrieve, analyze --date data numerous national international sources — tidy, analysis-ready formats.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: main features robonomistClient include: Comprehensive Data Coverage Access data national statistical agencies, international organizations, regional sources — one place. Spend less time searching data time analyzing . Eurostat, OECD, World Bank, European Central Bank, . High Data Fidelity Trust data reliable accurately reflects information official statistical agencies. Datasets include comprehensive metadata, ensuring analysis based credible transparent information. Full transparency data sources. Detailed metadata included. Flexibility Data Retrieval Customize way data retrieved fit specific needs: Multilingual support Choose variable labels codes. Interpret time variables dates raw values. Seamless Integration Dynamic Workflows Designed robust integration R, robonomistClient makes easy build dynamic documents automatically updating applications: Provides stable API, reducing disruptions changes official statistics APIs. Focus insights, data wrangling.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package provides seamless efficient access wide range datasources via Robonomist Data Server. support 101 636 --date data tables across 60 distinct datasources 13 languages, package designed streamline data analysis workflow. International Datasources Global Institutions: OECD, International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, United Nations Economic Commission Europe Statistical Database (UNECE), United Nations Conference Trade Development (UNCTAD), FAO (Food Agriculture Organization), Bank International Settlements (BIS). European Union: Eurostat, European Commission, European Central Bank (ECB). Nordic Countries: Statistics Sweden, Swedish National Institute Economic Research, Swedish Agricultural Agency, Statistics Norway, Statistics Denmark, Statistics Iceland, Statistics Estonia, Nordic Statistics Database. Finnish Datasources Statistics Finland: StatFin, StatFin archive databases, Municipal figures & financial data, Paavo postal code area statistics, experimental statistics, immigrants integration database. Regional Data: Helsingin seudun aluesarjat -tilastotietokanta, Helsingin ympäristötilasto. National Agencies: Finnish Tax Administration, Finnish Centre Pensions, Natural Resources Institute Finland (LUKE), Traficom (Finnish Transport Communications Agency), Customs Finland, THL Sotkanet, Vipunen (Education Statistics Finland), Fingrid, TutkiHallintoa.fi (Valtiokonttori). Thematic & Specialized Datasources Energy & Environment: Entso-E Transparency Platform, U.S. Energy Information Administration database, Fingrid. Financial: Deutsche Bundesbank time series database, FRED (Federal Reserve Economic Data**. Health & Pandemic Data: THL Epirapo, ECDC. list highlights just many datasources available robonomistClient package.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: set Robonomist Data Server organization, contact team@robonomist.com.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: Install package GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if needed # install.packages("devtools")  # Install robonomistClient from GitHub devtools::install_github("robonomist/robonomistClient")

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: Set hostname access token Robonomist Data Server using set_robonomist_server():
code: library(robonomistClient)  set_robonomist_server(hostname = "hostname.com", access_token = "abc")

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server

what: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: data() convenience function searches database returns search results multiple matching tables found, data one match found. data_get() returns data given table id without performing searching, url parsing pattern filters, prefered programmatic use-cases robustness speed important. data_get() result error, match exists. data_search() performs search returns list matching data tables without downloading data.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
code: dаta(   pattern = "",   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = getOption("robonomistClient.labels"),   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = getOption("robonomistClient.tidy_time"),   ...  )  data_get(   id,   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = getOption("robonomistClient.labels"),   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = getOption("robonomistClient.tidy_time"),   ... )  data_search(pattern = "")

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: pattern Character. Search query table id, possibly followed §-filter. dl_filter List named vector. download filter passed datasource download functions filter data download. See Details. labels Logical. FALSE, variable values returned codes instead labels. lang Two-letter language code, e.g. "en" "sv". na.rm Logical. TRUE, supported datasource, missing values removed returned data frame upon retrieval. tidy_time Logical. TRUE, time dimension parsed Date class renamed time. NULL, datasource specific default used. ... arguments passed datasource download functions. id, Character. Exact table id. multiple ids provided character vector, bound row-wise single data frame.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: data() function allows special §-filter. pattern matches single table function returns data frame, §-filter can used subset rows data frame. tibble filterd sequence regular expressions separated section sign §. regular expression applied data frame's variables sequentially. last variable date, used start date filter.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: datasources (e.g. datasets "ecb" & "tulli") allow downloading full data tables, always preferred due large large size table. datasources user must provide download filter via dl_filter argument. argument left NULL,  data function return list variables potential values. list can used construct suitable download filter. Generally, dl_filter named list names variable names values character vectors selected values (see Examples). Alternatively, datasources allow dot-separated string define download filter.

what: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: Saves R object x file .rdlock extension, effectively "locking" value reproducible use. file already exists overwrite FALSE, function reads returns existing value instead overwriting .

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
code: datalock(   x,   name = NULL,   path = getOption("robonomistClient.datalock.path"),   overwrite = getOption("robonomistClient.datalock.overwrite", FALSE) )

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: x R object save lock. name Optional. file name use. NULL, name generated hash expression x. Must single, non-empty character string provided. path Optional. Directory path save file. Defaults value 'robonomistClient.datalock.path' option. NULL, saves current working directory. overwrite Logical. TRUE, overwrites existing file. FALSE (default), reads returns existing file present.

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
code: library(tibble)  # Lock and save a data frame locked_df1 <-   tibble(x = runif(3), y = c("a", "b", "c")) |>   datalock()  # Now re-running the same code retrieves the locked data instead of generating new random values locked_df2 <-   tibble(x = runif(3), y = c("a", "b", "c")) |>   datalock()  # Check that the locked data is identical identical(locked_df1, locked_df2)  # TRUE #> [1] TRUE

text: function deprecated data() function now supports direct data fetching various datasources. fetch_data_from_url() function designed facilitate easy access data parsing copied URL websites various datasources. forms query database retrieves data R using robonomistclient package.
